owl:Ontology.rdfs:comment: Final version:4.0; Date:June 23, 2008; This ontolgy is updated by Shiyan Ou in University of Wolverhampton and reviewed by Christian Spurk in DFKI.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The language used for the caption of a movie
A country can contain one or more destination.
Driving directions and location to a specific site
The nearby sites to a specific site
A destination may contain some smaller destinations.
A destination may contain one or more site which could be a accommodation, attraction, gastro or infrastructure.
The language spoken in a site.
A destination or a site must be located in a countr.
A site must be located in a destnation.
A destination may be a part of a bigger destination.

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Here award refers to a restaurant award or a movie award. A restaurant ward is to recognize the creativity, outstanding customer service and top quality dining that is on offer in the restaurants in a region, e.g. The Scottish Restaurant awards 2008. A movie award is to recognize achievements in cinema, usually by awarding various prizes, e.g. the 'Oscar' for Hollywood's Academy Awards.
For example, Topless bars, Sports bars, Dance bars.
if it is differnt from the website URL
if it is different from the telephone
bulding name and room number

A motion picture rating system categorizes films with regard to suitability for audiences in terms of issues such as sex, violence, substance abuse, profanity, impudence or other types of mature content. A particular issued rating is called a certification/certificate.
For example, Concert clubs, R&B clubs, Rock clubs.
it is treated as a string instead of a person object since contact person is not an important search target.
Country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-3) is a three-part geographic coding standard for coding the names of countries and dependent areas, and the principal subdivisions thereof.

Cuisine is a specific set of cooking traditions and practices, often associated with a specific culture. A cuisine is primarily influenced by the ingredients that are available locally or through trade.
Currency code (ISO 4217) is the international standard describing three letter codes to define the names of currencies established by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO).
It refers to descrptive information about how to go to a site by drive or walk.
The exchage rate is to EUR.
Language code represents natural language identifiers as defined by RFC 3066.
It refers to descrptive information about bus and metro to a site.
The items in a category of foods or drinks in a menu, for example, different drink items in "Drinks", different items in "Starters".
It refers to the categories of foods and drinks, e.g. Drinks, Desserts, Starters, Main courses.
The number of the rooms which can provide main services in a site, for example, guest rooms and conference rooms in an accommodation, screens in a cinema.
Sometimes it could be average price.
The products sold in a store or shopping center.
The number of the persons which can be served by a room.
e.g. single room, double room, en-suit room
e.g. book store, computer store, dress store, jewellery store
street name and street number
The default unit is "meter"

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A accommodation is lodging in a dwelling or similar living quarters afforded to travellers, usually on a short-term basis (from wikepedia). This class does not include those on vehicles such as cruise ships.
Here, activity refers to other activities in which people can participate, as opposed to just being members of audience, e.g. outdoor adventures for children.
For example, city halls, embassies, and other government departments which provide adminstration service to the public.
An airport terminal is a building at an airport where passengers transfer between ground transportation and the facilities that allow them to board and disembark from airplanes (from wikipedia).
A tourist attraction is a place of interest where tourists visit (from wikipedia).

This subclass includes bar, pub and tavern. A bar is a establishment that sells drinks, typically alcoholic beverages, for immediate on-premises consumption. A public house, usually known as a pub, is an establishment which serves alcoholic drinks especially beer for consumption on the premises, usually in a homely setting. A tavern is, loosely, a place of business where people gather to drink alcoholic beverages and, more than likely, also be served food, though not licenced to put up guests (from wikipedia).

A Bed and Breakfast (often referred to as a B&B) is a type of boarding house typically operating out of a large single family residence. Guests are accommodated at night in private bedrooms and breakfast is served in the morning - either in the bedroom or, more commonly, in a dining room or the host's kitchen (from wikipedia).
A local bus has many stops, and thus it is not necessary to list all the stops. Here, a bus station only refers to the starting and ending points of a bus line.

A café is a type of cafeteria, often with an enclosed or outdoor section extending onto the pavement or sidewalk, where meals are served. Generally serving coffee and other beverages, cafés (or more commonly known as cafeterias) also serve meals but this is generally not considered their main trade in contrast to a restaurant (from wikepedia).

A campsite (or campground) is a place used for overnight stay in the out of doors. It has two types -- an impromptu area (as one might decide to stop while backpacking or hiking) or a dedicated area with improvements and various facilities (from wikipedia).
A ceremony is an activity, infused with ritual significance, performed on a special occasion, e.g. festival celebration.

A chalet is a family or group residence in mountain resorts, or in costal regions of the United Kingdom as self-catering holiday destinations. It can be booked from private owners or tour operators (from wikipedia).
People who create choreographies are called choreographers (from wikipedia).
A cinema, also known as movie theatre or movie house, is a venue, usually a building, for viewing motion pictures ("movies" or "films") (from wikipedia).

A nightclub (often shortened to club) is an drinking, dancing and entertainment venue which does its primary business after dark. A nightclub is usually distinguished from other forms of drinking and entertainment establishments, such as bars, pubs or taverns, by the inclusion of a dance floor (from wikipedia).
This class refers to all the coach stations rathen than only starting and end points.
Here, competition means sports-related competition. A competition must have two or more competitors.
Competitor is a individual or group who participants in a sports or game competition.
A composer is a person who writes music.

A concert is a live performance, usually of music, before an audience. The music may be performed by a single musician, sometimes then called a recital, or by a musical ensemble, such as an orchestra, a choir, or a musical band (from wikipedia).
A conductor(music) is a person who leads a musical ensemble by way of visible gestures.
This class contains contact information for a tourism site or a tourism event.
A convention, in the sense of a meeting, is a gathering of individuals who meet at a pre-arranged place and time in order to discuss or engage in some common interest.
A cottage is a dwelling, typically in a rural, or semi-rural location, although there are cottage-style dwellings in cities (from wikepedia).

A country is a geographical entity, territory, most commonly associated with the notions of state or nation (from wikepedia). Currently this class only involves four countries of QALL-ME partners. In the QallMe ontology, a country individual must have at least one tourism desitination individual which is from the "Destination" class.

Cultural heritage refers to a nation's historic monuments, museum collections, gallery collections, etc, which are inherited from one's ancestors. Here clutural heritage also includes industrial heritage excludes religious heritage which is treated as another subclass since there are lots of churchs, temples in a tourism destination.

A tourism destination is a city, town, villiage, or other area, the economy of which is dependent to a significant extent on the revenues accruing from tourism (from wikepedia). Some times a destionation is aslo a country, e.g. Singapore. To simplify this case, a destination is also created under the country of the same name. A desintaion may contain some smaller destinations or a part of a bigger destination. In the QallMe ontology, a destination individual must be in a country individual from the "Country" class.
This subclass contains direction information for a site, i.e. describing how to get to a site on foot or by car.
A director is a person directs the making of a film (film director) or oversees and orchestrates the mounting of a play by unifying various endeavors and aspects of production (theatrical director).
This class indicates the distance (meters) from a specfic site to another site.

A film distributor is an independent company, a subsidiary company or occasionally an individual, which acts as the final agent between a film production company or some intermediary agent, and a film exhibitor, to the end of securing placement of the producer's film on the exhibitor's screen (from wikipedia). In the film business, the term "distribution" refers to the marketing and circulation of movies in theaters, and for home viewing, e.g. DVD, Video-On-Demand, Television etc.
An event refers to an occurrence with a specific content in a specific site and for a specific time period, e.g. movie show.

Here event content refers to cultural or social events of interest to tourists. We divided an event into two parts – static for its content and dynamic for its occurrences. EventContent refers to the static information of an event.

An exhibition can be a presentation of art work or other objects (e.g. books, industrial products) in an exhibition hall. Here exhibition refers to non-permanent ones in a specific period, since permanent exhibition is regarded as a built-in part of a specific site (e.g. museum and gallery).
Facility refers to something designed and created to serve a particular function and to afford a particular convenience or service.
This subclass contains GPS coordinate information for a site.
A gastro is a place for providing prepared food, drink or both for travellers.

A genre is a loose set of criteria for a category of composition; the term is often used to categorize literature and speech, but is also used for any other form of art or utterance. Here it mainly refers to movie genre.
Gym, a shortened form of gymnasium, refers to facilities intended for indoor sports or exercise.

A hostel provides accommodation where guests can rent a bed, sometimes a bunk bed, in a dormitory and share a common bathroom, kitchen, and lounge. Rooms can be mixed or single-sex, although private rooms are increasingly common in all types of hostels (from wikepedia).

A hotel often provides a number of additional guest services such as a restaurant, a swiming pool or childcare. Some hotels have conference services and meeting rooms and encourage groups to hold conventions and meetings at their location (from wikepedia). A motel is regarded as a kind of hotel specifically for motorists.
This class refers to the vehicles connecting two terminals located in two different cities or towns, such as flight, train, coach and ship.
This class refers to the vehicles connecting two terminals within the same city or town, such as bus and metro.
This class refers to all the metro stations rathen than only starting and end points.
Natural heritage refers to a nation's fauna and flora, natural resources, and landscape, including natural park, reserve, walk, national park etc.
A party is a social gathering for celebration or recreation.

Artists who participate in performing arts in front of an audience are called performers, including actors, comedians, dancers, musicians, players and singers (from wikipedia). The movie actors/actresses which are called stars are not included.
This class contains all kinds of persons or groups (or organizations), including Star, Director, Writer, Performer, Conductor, Producer, Composer, Competitor, Choreographer, Service Provider, Studio.
This subclass contains postal information for a site.
This class contains price information for a product or a service.
A producer is a person who oversees the staging of theatre productions (theatrical producer) or oversees the making of films (film producer).
This subclass includes church, cathedral, temple, abbey etc.
A resort often combines a hotel and a variety of recreations, such as swimming pools, entertainment facilities (from wikipedia).
A restaurant is an establishment that serves prepared food and beverages to order, to be consumed on the premises (from wikipedia).

A room must provide some specific kinds of room facilities to realize its function. For example, a guest room must provide guest room facilities (e.g. shower, telephone); a cinema room must provide some cinema room facilities (e.g. induction hearing loop); a conference room must provide some conference room facilities (e.g. projector); and a restaurant must provide some restaurant room facilities (e.g. big table).
It refers to a facility provided by a kind of room, for example, TV, shower, king-size bed provide in a double guestroom.
A seaport is a facility for receiving ships to and from them and usually situated at the edge of an ocean or sea, river, or lake (from wikipedia).
An company who provides services.

Here show means theatre production in order to avoid the same term "theatre" refering to an building. Theatre is the branch of the performing arts concerned with acting out stories in front of an audience using combinations of speech, gesture, mime, puppets, music, dance, sound and spectacle — indeed any one or more elements of the other performing arts. In addition to the standard narrative dialogue style, theatre takes other forms, such as opera, operettas, ballet, mime, kabuki, puppetry, classical Indian dance, Chinese opera, mummers' plays, improvisational theatre and pantomime (from wikipedia).
It refers to a facility provied by a site, which usually does not belong to a specfic kind of room, for example, swimming pool, bar, car park for a hotel.

A modern stadium is a place, or venue, for (mostly) outdoor sports, concerts or other events, consisting of a field or stage partly or completely surrounded by a structure designed to allow spectators to stand or sit and view the event.
A movie star or film star is a celebrity who is a person known for his or her roles in motion pictures.
A film studio is synonymous with "major film production company", due largely to the fact that the leading production companies owned their own studio facilities, as do a few today.

In travel and transport, a terminal may mean airport terminal ( a building at an airport), terminal station(a passenger rail station), seaport terminal (a facility which handles shipping), and pipeline terminal (a storage facility at the downstream end of a pipeline transport) (from wikipedia).

A theater or theatre is a structure where theatrical works or plays are performed or other performances such as musical concerts may be given (from wikipedia). It includes arena, concert hall, opera house and so on. All theaters provide a acting space generally known as stage and a space for their audience.
Today, amusement parks have largely been replaced by theme parks, and the two terms are often used interchangeably.

A ticket is a voucher to indicate that one has paid for admission to an event or establishment such as a theatre, movie theater, amusement park, zoo, museum, concert, or other attraction, or permission to travel on a vehicle such as an airliner, train, bus, or boat, typically because one has paid the fare (from wikipedia).
A train terminal station refers to the termination of the railway line or service at that point (from wikipedia).
Transportation (or transport) refers to public vehicles which can transfer customers from one place to another.
A scriptwriter is a person who writes scripts for movies, plays, television, comedy shows, political speeches and other presentations.

A zoo is a facility in which animals are confined within enclosures and displayed to the public, and in which they may also be bred. It also includes zoological garden, zoological park. A public aquarium is the aquatic counterpart of a zoo, housing aquatic species for viewing.
